quarks.providers.direct

Class DirectProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • quarks.topology.spi.AbstractTopologyProvider<DirectTopology>
      • quarks.providers.direct.DirectProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DirectSubmitter<Topology,Job>, Submitter<Topology,Job>, TopologyProvider
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DevelopmentProvider

    public class DirectProvider
extends quarks.topology.spi.AbstractTopologyProvider<DirectTopology>
implements DirectSubmitter<Topology,Job>
    DirectProvider is a TopologyProvider that runs a submitted topology as a Job in threads in the current virtual machine.

    A job (execution of a topology) continues to execute while any of its elements have remaining work, such as any of the topology's source streams are capable of generating tuples.
    "Endless" source streams never terminate - e.g., a stream created by generate(), poll(), or events(). Hence a job with such sources runs until either it or some other entity terminates it.

    • Method Detail

      • getServices

        public ServiceContainer getServices()
        Access to services. Since any executables are executed directly within the current virtual machine, callers may register services that are visible to the executable and its elements.

        The returned services instance is shared across all jobs submitted to this provider.

        Specified by:
        getServices in interface DirectSubmitter<Topology,Job>
        Returns:
        Service container for this submitter.

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<Job> submit(Topology topology)
        Description copied from interface: Submitter
        Submit an executable. No configuration options are specified, this is equivalent to submit(executable, new JsonObject()).
